instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message: Need help with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Runs perfectly fine on battery but the moment i connect the adapter cable it shuts down completely. I changed the DC board but still same behavior. I have a green light that turns yellow but no voltage on F7140 when connected to Adapter. 7.6v on F7140 on battery and boots up all the way. What direction do i move to begin with?

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
If board works on battery, you have a problem on input power stage.
Disconnect battery and tell us if get voltage at <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> on charger alone?
If not, check <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 16.1v
<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>
Pin 1 - 16.5v
Pin 4 - 6.8v
Pin 5 - 16.52v
Pin 6 - 15.52v
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> - 10.3 ohms
<DIODE>D7012</DIODE> seems fine too.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 16.1v"
Do NOT joke; post accurate information, please!!!
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP> voltages?
Also post for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
Sorry my oversight...
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4v

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
Pin 1 - 8.5mv
Pin 2 - 16.22v
Pin 3 - 4.33v
Pin 9 - 58.3mv
Pin 12 - 3.41v
Pin 13 - 2.8v
Pin 14 - 3.3v
Pin 15 -51.5mv
pin 17 - 0v
Pin 19 - 5.06v
Pin 20 - 5.05v
Pin 27 - 16.1

<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
Pin 1 - 1.9v
Pin 2 - 3.4v
Pin 3 - 7.2v
Pin 4 - 3.4v
Pin 6 - 16.1v
Pin 8 - 16.1v

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message:
Check/replace <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> ans <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
If still the same, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> too.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works only on battery.
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Got a fan spin and board up and working. Thank you.
